title: Foreshadowing?
body:
A woman who disguises herself as a knight to fight in a tourney huh? Where does that sound familiar? 

We see you GRRM…. we see you. cough Knight of the Laughing Tree cough

summary: Honestly, I don't think I blame Tyrion for "giving Dany bad advices". He's now serving a khal and tries his best to turn all...
body:
Honestly, I don’t think I blame Tyrion for “giving Dany bad advices”. He’s now serving a khal and tries his best to turn all this into serving a queen. He knows Dany has no right for the throne, but he believes Dany’s “good heart” worths avoiding these rights.

RANDYLL:

I already have a queen.

TYRION:

My sister. She wasn’t your Queen until recently, though, was she? When she murdered your rightful Queen..

“Eastwatch”, s7ep5

So he just called Margaery a rightful Queen. He knows the rules and has no illusions about Dany’s rights. He has no secret True-King-Whose-Name-Is-Targaryen-Faith in his heart. And after this dialogue we see him unable to look at Tarlys, turning to Daenerys and finding himself unable to look at her too. He begins to understand who she really is.

But why didn’t he leave her, betray her, run away from her? Because he hopes he can deal with it. Because he once was Hand and served King Joffrey, one more impulsive uneducated “rightful” ruler. Tyrion even treats both Dany and Joffrey pretty much the same: he knows how important it is to look like a ruler with a good heart™ than actually be that ruler. He insists on Joffrey taking part in battle of Blackwater to convince people, that he might not have the rights but he has good intentions and cares for people. Just like he advices Dany not to take King’s Landing with Dothraki and Unsullied, so she wouldn’t seem a foreign invader who she actually is.

Tyrion is not one of my favourite character, but I can not blame him for his unability to make a good queen out of Daenerys.

tags: I SEE yall shipping those cousins
summary: here’s the thing. I always laugh when someone says ‘but they were raised as siblings’ cuz let me tell ya i’m a slut for time...
body:
here’s the thing.

I always laugh when someone says ‘but they were raised as siblings’ cuz let me tell ya i’m a slut for time period dramas.

do you know how many time period dramas I have watched where character a & b are cousins and are raised in the same household or area like siblings???? then when they reach a certain age they see each other in a different way after maturing and becoming who they are meant to be then fall in in love. 

also, don’t get me started on soap operas!! 

so no ja and js don’t bother me. I mostly love their dynamics and ship them in aus a lot, and it depends on mooood if i’m into them but you get my drift. 

if you don’t like them because they are incestuous that’s fine. but don’t be a hypocrite and say oh you can’t cuz they were raised together like we all don’t watch many time period dramas outside this show/books.
